answers.answer: Well as far as names go my husband and I picked a sex with both of our children and picked the names. He had a girl and I had a boy so as long as the other didn't hate the name then when we found out what we were having we stuck to our agreement. Good Luck
We did the same thing as the poster above.  I picked the boy, and my husband picked the girl name. We are 22 wks with a girl, her name is going to be Hannah Marie.

Maybe the best way to settle it is get a name book and go down the list.  It is sometimes hard just to think one up - at least for me.  Go get a book for girl names, sit down and go through it.  I think this may be a good way to pick one you both like.
I hear your pain.  I am 31 weeks and still no name for our baby girl.  2nd one so its really hard. my husband and i have totally different tastes.  this is hard!!

The good thing is that you still have time to find the name.  Both of you need to keep pitching the names out.  The right one not first thought of might just appear.  Good Luck.  I had a girls name picked out for years (Bella), of course we are having a boy. My dad brought up a name that we would never have thought of.  We love it and it seems all of our friends do as well.

I am still stumbling on names for a definate but dh and I have picked 2 of each... Boys names Isaac Jon or Cooper Andrew (Andrew John is dh name) and Girls names Julia Ellen or Isabella Grace (Ellen, Isabel are dh grandmothers names and Grace is my grandmothers middle name)...Now just deciding which ones to use but we wont know till bub is born of the sex..by choice!

have you at least picked out some possibilities for names, or do you have no idea whatsoever?  The way I see it, your husband certainly deserves to have input and throw in ideas, but in the end, after going through labor and delivery, the decision is pretty much yours :) (as long as your husband doesn't hate it)
ps-if you are interested in going through this together- helping each other out with names, please dont hesitate to email me at ***@****  if you dont need the help, that is fine too!good luck!

well i let my husband pick her first name and i picked the middle and somehow they worked out. kinda long i know and some of the family is putting there noses in the air about her name but she is OUR baby so he picked*jesse-sophia(JESSE is my uncles name and he passed away 2years ago on my hubbys bday, i love the name jesse, NOT TO OFFEND ANYONE PLEASE BUT i dont like jessica at all so that is why he picked jesse, and SOPHIA was the name i was suposta have but was given victoria elizabeth)** i picked maeleigh for her middle name(my sisters middle names put together, SAVANNAH MAE, & CRYSTAL LEIGH)it just all worked out. for us.

question: Hello everyone!!  I have posted on here just a few times before a couple months ago and have sorta been lurking around!Well I am almost 19 weeks.  After fighting with my drs they finally changed my due date from May 21st to May 13th.  They did something funky when they dated it early in oct per an ultrasound.  I knew i was further along than that because I don't understand how i could have possibly gotten a positive test 7 days after the suggested conception date they gave me.  crazy!!  We just found out that we are having a girl!!  Now we cannot agree on names for nothing!!!  Anyone else having this issue???I have also just been diagnosed with the gestational diabetes. They did my test early because of my PCOS and family history of diabetes.  Now I am on insulin shots cuz as good as I have been eating my blood sugars are still really high!  The shots are not that bad, in fact they hurt less than poking my fingers 4 times a day!!!Anywhoo...i hope every one is doing great!!!  Chat away!!
title: Help!!  We cannot agree on girl names!!!, Gestational diabetes, Open forum too!!
